title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 18 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: north shropshire college merger plans dropped .
shrewsbury sign striker payne to permanent deal .

documents.title: baby born size of hand fronts £ 2m appeal
text: baby born size of hand fronts £ 2m appeal

documents.title: increase in visible policing at v festival at weston park
text: increase in visible policing at v festival at weston park

documents.title: shrewsbury town 3-2 rochdale
text: shrewsbury town 3-2 rochdale

documents.title: family living world tour 'dream '
text: family living world tour 'dream '

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: another car arson in telford
text: another car has been deliberately set on fire in telford , police say .
three cars were wrecked when a man set them alight in overdale on wednesday and this morning a vauxhall astra was targeted by arsonists in arleston .
the police say two people were seen running away from the scene .

documents.title: v festival 'changing with the times '
text: the man responsible for organising the v festival , which takes place at weston park this weekend , said it has to constantly evolve to keep up with the times .
for instance , andy redhead explained that 10 years ago almost everyone brought tents and camped on the site , but now they sold a lot of day-tickets to people who go home at the end of each day .
mr redhead said they also had to keep up with current musical trends and watch what their competitors were doing , to make sure they get the best acts .
this year 's big act will be jay z and he said it was the only european festival the rapper had agreed to do .
you know what people like , but you 've got to be aware of what trends are , if things are changing , and customers want something else then you have to change with that . ''

documents.title: watch : ex-jls star visits shropshire for songs of praise
text: if you 're watching songs of praise this weekend you might spot st andrew 's church in wroxeter .
it features in a report by the former jls star jb gill on `` champing '' - a form of holiday-making which involves staying in a church .
it will be his debut on the programme , which is on bbc one on sunday at 14:15 .

documents.title: weather : showers tomorrow and more on sunday
text: we 'll have a few showers tomorrow and more on sunday , but the weather is expected to improve next week .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : argentine family 'living their dreams ' on world tour
text: a couple from argentina say they are living the dreams they had as teenagers , by touring the world in a vintage car .
herman and candelaria zapp are travelling with their four children , who were all born on the road .
and they are in shrewsbury this week , to meet a family they met while travelling around spain .

documents.title: tips for a special parkrun weekend
text: it 's a special weekend in parks around the country .
tomorrow , those who take part in their local parkrun might find themselves jogging alongside some of the country 's sporting stars .
it 's all part of campaign for national lottery funded athletes to give back and say thank you .
and , if you 've never heard of of done a parkrun , it 's really easy to get involved .
here 's team gb rowing legend katherine grainger to give you the low down in five simple steps

documents.title: a teenager tried to smuggle 200 pills into v festival
text: a teenager 's been found trying to smuggle 200 pills into the v festival site at weston park .
routine bag searches by staffordshire police turned up the tablets and the 17-year-old from stone 's been arrested for possession with intent to supply .
separately , the force says a 16-year-old boy was thrown out of the event after 28 mdma pills were seized from him and he was also referred to youth offending for rehabilitation .
author: Phil Bowers
Journalist, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: victorian town holds steam weekend
text: blists hill victorian town is showing off some of its steam-powered machines this weekend .
they include a replica of richard trevithick 's 1802 coalbrookdale locomotive ( below ) - believed to be the world 's first passenger steam locomotive .
other machines included a steam-powered road roller , a fire pump and ploughing engines .
there will also be a number of engines around ironbridge throughout the weekend .

documents.title: nuclear test veteran supporting campaign for recognition
text: a man from telford who was stationed on christmas island when nuclear tests were carried out in the 1950s and 60s has called for recognition for his fellow veterans .
maurice viney from trench was one of around 21,000 british servicemen who were exposed to these tests and fewer than 3,000 are thought to be alive today .
he said he was there for about 14 months and there were four tests carried out in that time - now he has to have a blood test every 12 months to monitor the effects .
we 're just looking for recognition that we were there and that we did our time and served our time . ''

documents.title: football : telford manager looks for team-bonding
text: the afc telford united manager , rob edwards , is looking to build a little squad-togetherness on their away trip to darlington this weekend .
they are travelling up today and staying overnight , so they 're planning to have a quiz in their hotel as a team-bonding exercise .
and edwards said that while they want to avoid `` living in each other 's pockets '' it was important for them to get to know each other .
the more time you 're together , the better .
you get to know each other and it is really important . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: v festival : jay z and pink headlining this weekend
text: this weekend 's v festival in staffordshire will see rapper jay z headline the event tomorrow and popstar pink then headline on sunday .
for those not familiar with how the event works , it takes place over two sites , one at weston park and the other in essex .
performers appear at both locations , swapping over the two nights .
as well as the headliners , those at the festival will also see craig david , madness , stormzy , ellie goulding and clean bandit - among many more .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: tips for a special parkrun weekend # teamparkrun
text: it 's a special weekend in parks around the country .
this saturday , 19 august , those who take part in their local parkrun might find themselves jogging alongside some of the country 's sporting stars .
it 's all part of campaign for national lottery funded athletes to give back and say thank you .
and , if you 've never heard of of done a parkrun , it 's really easy to get involved .
here 's team gb rowing legend katherine grainger to give you the low down in five simple steps

documents.title: your questions on london midland losing its rail franchise answered
text: rail services in the west midlands are to be run by a new operator from december - but what does this mean for passengers ?
west midlands trains ltd says it will put £ 1bn into improving the routes it takes over from london midland .
the plans include 400 new carriages , free wifi and space for an extra 85,000 passengers on rush-hour services in birmingham and london .
news website readers sent in questions about the takeover and you can read some of the answers here .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: more than 600 turn out for memorial to young farmer
text: more than 600 people have gathered to pay tribute to 19-year-old james corfield , who died after disappearing from the royal welsh show last month .
the celebration featured tributes from his brother and sister and was held at montgomery cricket club where the teenager played .
people arrived at the event wearing items of blue clothing as james had done when he was last seen .

blue balloons lined the pavilion and blue car board hearts were included within the orders of service for people to share memories of james , who was a member of the chirbury and marton young farmers group .

documents.title: monster tank to make appearance at minsterley show
text: this 48-tonne monster is due to make an appearance at the minsterley show tomorrow .
the leopold mk1 tank was made in 1972 and has was refurbished by enthusiasts in 2000 after being decomissioned by the belgian armed forces .

ian galliers is one of those who have brought it over to the uk and he told us it was also going to make an appearance at the steam rally in shrewsbury at the bank holiday weekend , where it might be used to pull a tractor .

documents.title: police investigating car fire in telford
text: police are appealing for witnesses or information following a car fire in telford during the early hours of this morning .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: v festival : queues 'busy but happy ' at site
text: there are queues already at the entrance to weston park as festival-goers arrive ahead of this weekend 's v festival .
staffordshire police 's ch insp mark joynson who 's at the site for the force says people in the queue are happy , even if it is busy .
at east gate entrance getting busy but everyone just hope those clouds pass on by @ twitterid
if i see someone using cannabis should i call 999 or make a citizens arrest officer ?
# vfestival
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : cloudy scenes in oswestry and newport
text: the bbc weather watchers are sharing more of their photos from around the county this afternoon .
these ones were taken near oswestry ( top ) and newport ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: college merger proposals dropped
text: plans to merge north shropshire college and reeseheath college in nantwich have been shelved after failing to attract government funding .
north shropshire college has been struggling with its finances and with critical inspection reports .
the two institutions have been working together for over a year , to turn things around .
they say they 'd been in talks with two government funding agencies for 10 months , but had to conclude `` there is not a viable solution '' .

the two colleges now say they will look for an alternative way forward , rather than a merger , to `` ensure that the outcome serves the needs of our students , employers and community as effectively as possible '' .
the conclusion to this process is disappointing to both colleges and the government , but we have explored all possible long-term funding support and unfortunately there is not a viable solution . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury re-sign payne from barnsley
text: shrewsbury re-sign payne from barnsley

documents.title: travelling argentine family visit shrewsbury
text: an argentine family , who are touring the world in a 1928 vintage car , have made a stop-off in shrewsbury .
the zapps have been travelling for 17 years now and decided to visit shropshire after meeting a family from the county while they were in spain .
herman and candeleria zapp raised all four of their children while travelling the world and are staying in shrewsbury for a few days before carrying on with their adventure .

documents.title: football : the new saints look to bounce back against bala
text: the new saints are looking to put last friday 's shock 5-2 defeat to bangor city behind them and get their first win of the new season when they host bala tomorrow .
bala denied tns another treble with victory in the welsh cup final last season and won their first match of the new season 3-0 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 17th century oswestry pub reopens
text: a 17th century black-and-white timbered pub has reopened in oswestry
the black gate closed three years ago and has had a refit inside .
stuart phillips from commercial property agents celt rowlands , who handled the sale of the black gate , said the deal shows oswestry 's economy is reviving .
and the new manager paul livingston said he was excited to see it open again .
it was in a right state , and we 've gutted what we can without touching the grade-listed building itself .
it 's a beautiful building , and it just draws you in . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : shrewsbury town sign payne on permanent deal
text: shrewsbury town have signed stefan payne from barnsley , for an undisclosed fee .
the 26-year-old striker was on loan from the yorkshire club last season , scoring twice in 12 league appearances .
he was on the bench for all three games for the tykes this season , but did n't score .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: oswestry couple describe barcelona shock
text: a couple on holiday in barcelona have spoken of their horror after a near miss with the terrorist attack that left scores dead .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your questions on new rail franchise
text: your questions on new rail franchise

documents.title: football : shrewsbury manager pleased with team spirit
text: shrewsbury town are at home to rochdale tomorrow , a side which has failed to live up to its expectations so far this season .
while shrewsbury have two wins out of two , their visitors have only collected one point so far .
shrewsbury manager paul hurst says he is keeping his players in check , to make sure they do n't get carried away with their bright start to the season , but thinks a good team spirit is developing .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: new zealand woman 's missing necklace found in ironbridge
text: a woman from new zealand has been reunited with the necklace she lost in ironbridge a fortnight ago , after an appeal on facebook .
nicole shimmin said it went missing while she was spending a day there and explained the pendant ( similar to the one below ) was very important to her - because it contained her son 's ashes .
she had to return home without it , but after nearly 5,000 people shared her post , it was eventually found and is being returned to her .
people have been on those pages and have been messaging me and giving so much support and understanding and love , it 's just been completely overwhelming . ''

documents.title: council flags fly at half mast
text: flags at telford council offices are flying at half mast today , as a mark of respect for the people killed and injured in the barcelona terrorist attack .

the council leader councillor shaun davies said his thoughts were with the victims and added `` sadly tragedies like this are happening all too regularly and this particular one has impacted citizens of at least 18 countries '' .

documents.title: judo star kelly edwards guest of honour in oswestry
text: telford judo star kelly edwards , who is due to compete at the world championships in budapest at the end of the month , will be returning for a rather different event closer to home .
the 2014 commonwealth games silver medallist will be guest of honour at this year 's oswestry community games on 24 september .
these fifth annual games - held in oswestry 's cae glas park - include sport , music , arts and dance , and encourage public participation .
`` it will be an absolute privilege to attend the oswestry community games , and i look forward to contributing towards making them another success , '' edwards said .
she is back to full fitness after missing the 2016 olym in rio .

documents.title: minsterley set for 142nd show
text: shropshire 's oldest one-day agricultural show returns tomorrow .
minsterley show has sheep racing , vintage vehicles and dog and livestock displays .
this year 's young farmers float parade has the theme `` islands of the world '' .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: plans to give village social club £ 30k makeover
text: plans are under way to revamp the village social club in clive .
it has been open for 84 years , and was built in the 1930s by local residents as a place where the community could get together .
local residents need to raise £ 30,000 to be able to transform it into the newly named clive hub .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : shrewsbury 's new fitness regime being monitored
text: a new fitness regime could be one of the reasons for shrewsbury town 's impressive start to the season and manager paul hurst says they 're monitoring its impact very closely .
he has praised the players ' effort in the opening three games and says he wants to see that continue .
hurst said it was usual to expect a drop-off in player 's fitness two or three games into a new season , but that had n't been the case this time around .

we 've got to try and monitor it , figure out whether [ the improvement in fitness ] is just because it 's early season , or whether [ the new fitness regime ] is something we really feel we can continue with . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: memorial for young farmer to be held
text: the life of a young farmer who died at the royal welsh show in powys last month will be celebrated today .
james corfield , 19 , who was a member of chirbury and marton young farmers group in shropshire , was found in the river wye six days after he was last seen .
a promising cricketer , he 'll be remembered at montgomery cricket club this afternoon .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather in 54-seconds
text: friday 's started with sunshine for much of the west midlands and here 's how the rest of the day and the start of this weekend is looking .
get the latest forecasts for your area at any other time via the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: thousands set to head to v festival
text: more than 70,000 people are expected to head to staffordshire today for this weekend 's v festival .
the event takes place over two sites - one in essex and the other at weston park near weston-under-lizard .
superstars including pink , jay z , ellie goulding , craig david and madness are all performing .
highways england says it 's expecting long queues on surrounding routes including the m6 as people head for the site .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live for shropshire
text: good morning .
this is bbc local live for shropshire and we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom to give you the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
you can get in touch too .
email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates in the evening and into the morning .

documents.title: health body could come out of special measures soon
text: shropshire 's clinical commissioning group could come out of special measures this year , nhs england has said .
the ccg has been struggling to control its finances and a new accountable officer was brought in to turn things around .
an nhs england report that went before the health commissioning body yesterday said it had seen `` positive progress '' being made .

documents.title: shropshire council congratulates a-level students
text: a-level students in the shropshire council area have had `` what promises to be another highly successful year '' the authority has said this afternoon .
results were collected at schools and colleges this morning , with telford and wrekin council saying its schools had seen the overall pass-rate increase .

documents.title: weather : some showers on the way tomorrow
text: we 're forecast a dry and mild night , but there could be a few showers tomorrow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: find another route , hs2 protesters told
text: campaigners have been told by hs2 bosses to come up with alternative routes for construction traffic building the high-speed rail line .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: contrasting water levels on two shropshire rivers
text: dave throup from the environment agency has pointed out a strange situation in shropshire this afternoon .
because of all the rain we 've been having the agency has had to issue a flood alert for the area where the rivers severn and vyrnwy meet - but at the same time the top of the river teme is dry .
mr throup explained that while the sources of the severn and vyrnwy in wales had been getting plenty of rain , the source of the teme , on the english border , has largely dodged the showers .
he said it 's not unusual for the teme , which has a small catchment area , to dry up and he was out last month rescuing stranded fish there .

documents.title: rugby : england coach predicts bright future for ludlow 's davies
text: england women 's rugby coach matt ferguson has tipped ludlow 's lark davies to be a star of the future .
the 22-year-old has three caps for her country and is part of the rfu 's elite player scheme , but missed out on selection for the world cup squad .
matt is from ludlow himself and said he was honoured to present lark , who plays for worcester valkyries , with her first cap in 2015 .
she 's got a bright future , works incredibly hard and is certainly one to look out for . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: broseley baby 's story highlights importance of transfer service
text: eight-month-old arlo watson , from broseley , has been transferred eight times by birmingham children 's hospital since he was born and his story is being used to highlight the importance of their transport service .
he was born four months early , weighing just 755g ( 1.6lbs ) and his condition was critical on a number of occasions .
the hospital 's charity is trying to raise £ 2m to equip four ambulances capable of safely shuttling around critically ill children and arlo 's face is on all their posters .
the money raised through the critical journeys appeal will also fund improvements to the call centre which operates the service .
arlo simply would n't be here without the kids/nts service .
they were the absolute experts who got him to where he needed to be , with minimum fuss and maximum skill .
i can not put into words what they mean to us , but we will be grateful to them for the rest of our lives . ''

documents.title: your photos : sunshine in longnor and oswestry
text: we had a few showers this morning , but it seems to have cleared up this afternoon , allowing the bbc weather watchers to get out and take photos like these in longnor ( top ) and oswestry ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : hurst warns fans to be cautious after dream start
text: shrewsbury town manager paul hurst is warning fans not to get carried away , despite their perfect start to the league one season .

they 've collected six points through victories over northampton and wimbledon , but hurst says they 've got some tough games over the next few weeks , against teams expected to challenge for promotion .
shrewsbury 's next game will be at home to winless rochdale , before a visit to top-of-the-table oxford united .
you want to try to get the points on the board as soon as you can because you 're never quite sure how your form is going to go .
but we 've set off in the right manner . ''

documents.title: more than 150 competitors for severn mile swim
text: the severn mile swim takes place again this weekend , with 155 people registered to take part .
the course will take them from the quarry to kingsland bridge in shrewsbury .

documents.title: telford road resurfacing on schedule
text: work to re-lay part of castlefields way in telford is on schedule to finish on 1 september , telford and wrekin council has said .
it is affecting a stretch between the castlefields roundabout to just past southall road and it was started after inspections uncovered cracks in the surface and damage beneath it .

documents.title: watch : broseley baby is face of children 's hospital appeal
text: an eight-month-old boy from broseley is the face of a new appeal to raise money for birmingham children 's hospital .
it wants £ 2m to kit out four critical care ambulances .
arlo watson was born four months early and is one of more than 2,000 critically ill children relying on the transfers every year .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: football : telford 's marsden a doubt for darlington trip
text: john marsden is unlikely to start for afc telford united away to darlington this weekend .
the striker up an ankle injury in monday 's game at curzon ashton and it 's still sore and swollen .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford to celebrate 50th anniversary with painted rocks
text: people in telford are being encouraged to decorate stones and hide them in public places , as part of the celebrations for the 50th anniversary of the town next year .
telford and wrekin council have borrowed the idea from the shropshire rocks facebook group and are calling it telford rocks .
artists are being asked to upload photos of their creations to the council facebook page and to the shropshire rocks page .

documents.title: football : tns finally get home draw in irn bru cup
text: the new saints have drawn livingston at home in the irn bru cup - the first time they 've had a home draw in the competition .
it started including the top teams from wales and northern ireland last season and tns reached the semi-final stage , beating livingston in the quarter finals .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : joy and despair over a-levels
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , we 'll be getting reaction to today 's a-level results across the region .
the first students to sit one of the new a-level exams have been learning how they did and we 'll also be hearing how west midlands ' universities are coping with the clearing process .
plenty to come on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: market drayton street closed by fire in shop
text: part of the high street in market drayton was shut off earlier , while firefighters dealt with a fire in a shop basement .
they say it started in some light fittings and they were called out at 09:16 and had it put out in an hour .

documents.title: ice hockey : fixtures for new season released
text: the fixtures are out for the new ice hockey season and telford tigers will start their campaign in the nihl north 1 at home to sheffield steeldogs on 2 september .
the two sides are familiar opponents , having both played in the english premier league together last season , before transferring to the nihl when it collapsed .

they will follow that up with a visit to the national ice centre in nottingham to play the lions the following day , before a cup match at home to another familiar opponent , basingstoke bison on 10 september .
the tigers division 2 side will open their campaign away to altrincham aces , before facing deeside dragons second team at the telford ice rink on 3 september .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : arsonist caught setting fire to car on cctv
text: an arsonist who set fire to a car in telford yesterday morning has been caught on cctv .
the fire spread to two other cars , wrecking all three and the police are appealing for help in catching the offender .

documents.title: shrewsbury parking charge rises slammed as 'excessive '
text: proposed changes to parking fees in shrewsbury have been condemned as excessive '' and counter-productive '' .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: watch : three cars wrecked by arsonist in telford
text: the owner of a car destroyed by an arsonist in telford yesterday morning says she now fears for her safety .
three cars were wrecked in the resulting fire and cctv footage caught the arsonist starting it .
heather said she was lucky the fire did n't spread further and that it was worrying that there was someone capable of doing this .

documents.title: higher proportion of telford students pass a-levels
text: the indications are that a higher proportion of telford students have passed their a-levels this year , telford and wrekin council has said .
young people have been opening their results this morning and adams grammar school is reporting an overall a-level pass rate of 99 % .

documents.title: football : increased competition could mean fewer starts for dodds
text: shrewsbury town manager paul hurst says there is more competition for places this season and that means players including louis dodds ( might have to spend time sitting on the bench .

the experienced striker made more than 30 appearances for the club last season , but was a substitute for the first two games of this season , before finding his way into the starting line-up against wimbledon .
hurst described him as `` an experienced campaigner '' who `` has always got the ability to pop up with a goal '' , but that he thinks dodds understands the situation .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : tns hope for home tie in cup draw
text: the new saints are hoping for a home game in the draw this lunchtime for the irn-bru cup , the scottish competition that also includes the top sides from the welsh and irish leagues .
last season , the saints reached the semi-finals , but were drawn away in every round - to forfar , livingston and st mirren .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: council gets mod award
text: shropshire council has won a ministry of defence award for supporting the armed forces .
it 's one of 33 charities , local authorities , and emergency services given the employer recognition scheme gold award .
the council 's been chosen because of its work to accomodate those who serve or veterans , including its partnership with raf shawbury .
other winners include network rail and the metropolitan police .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ludlow coach targets world cup semi-final
text: the england women 's rugby team will book their place in the world cup semi finals if they beat the usa in dublin today .
they are the defending champions and have won their first two games at this tournament .
one of the england coaches matt ferguson is from ludlow .
i 'm ludlow born and bred .
i was the first community rugby coach in shropshire in 2003 , through some funding from the men 's world cup win and that was the start of my professional coaching career . ''
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: bishop 's castle pilot takes care into homes
text: people in the bishop 's castle area should be able to access more care at home thanks to a pilot project which places more doctors and nurses out working in the community .
staff from bishop 's castle community hospital will spend the next three months providing care to people at home , while the hospital is closed temporarily so the floor can be replaced .
the project hopes to find new ways of working that could shorten or avoid hospital stays in the future .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : today 's weather in 54 seconds
text: it 's been a wet start for many of us in the west midlands - here 's how the rest of thursday is looking .
you can also find the latest forecasts at any other time on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to bbc local live for shropshire
this is where you can find the latest news , sport , travel and weather for the county .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email us , tweet us or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: rare night heron attracts crowds in shrewsbury
text: a feathered visitor to the dingle in shrewsbury is attracting a lot of interest at the moment .
it 's a night heron and they 're more commonly seen in southern europe or north africa , so are a rare sight in the uk .
only a few of these are seen in the uk .
now we have a # nightheron roosting in # shrewsbury and it 's drawing quite a crowd !
@ twitterid
beautiful .
is he still there ?

documents.title: unemployment up in the west midlands
text: unemployment went up by 5.8 % across the west midlands in the three months to june , according to data .
figures from the ons show 164,000 people are registered as out of work across the region - an increase of 3,000 people compared with the first three months of the year .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: motorcyclist dies in a41 crash
text: a motorcyclist has died after a crash on the a41 at prees heath this afternoon .
police say the victim was a man in his 70s and he came off his bike after a collision involving two cars and a lorry .
west midlands ambulance service said he was confirmed dead at the scene .

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: skies will cloud over this evening as rain erratically moves east with brisk winds .
rain will continue overnight , with some heavy bursts at times .
however , rain will start to clear towards dawn .
lows of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: ludlow couple unhappy with maternity progress
text: a ludlow couple who lost their baby eight years ago as a result of mistakes made by the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust say it 's `` worrying '' that the care quality commission still has concerns about its maternity services .

a cqc report published this morning criticised the management of maternity services and said the lessons of `` safety incidents '' were not always shared with staff and that there was a lack of post-natal ward rounds .
rhiannon davies said the report showed the hospitals were `` still failing on the basics '' and that she felt like banging her head against a wall .
health secretary jeremy hunt ordered an investigation into the shrewsbury and telford hospital nhs trust in april , after the bbc revealed there had been a number of avoidable baby deaths .
it 's worrying that eight years from kate 's death change is so slow and so chaotic that the cqc deem this to be a trust that still requires improvement . ''

documents.title: watch : young children learn from telford bmx champion
text: a national bmx champion from telford is passing on his skills to pre-school children .
callum edwards is helping the under-fives around a mini-track and some are venturing out on to the full-size circuit .
the youngest child learning at his home-track in dawley is just 18 months old .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: overnight a49 closures to last until september
text: shropshire 's a49 will be closed overnight to traffic for more than a month while resurfacing work is carried out .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: your photos : a fine day in longnor and oakengates
text: it 's turning into a fine afternoon in shropshire and we 've been getting some great shots of shropshire from the bbc weather watchers this lunchtime ,
these photos were taken in longnor and oakengates .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: award for ludlow rugby club
text: ludlow rugby club have been named shropshire club of the year by the north midlands rugby football union .
last season they won the midlands west third division title , scoring more than 1,000 points in the process .

documents.title: whitchurch herald front page : air rifle fired at houses
text: doors and windows of homes in whitchurch have been smashed by someone blasting an air rifle at the houses .
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: tribute from school after teacher 's death
text: the lakelands academy in ellesmere has paid tribute to teacher craig colley who died last week , after a suspected cardiac arrest .

it said the school community had been devastated to learn of his sudden death and that he had been teaching there for 12 years and had `` inspired generations of young people who were lucky to have known him '' .
mr colley died after he collapsed and stopped breathing last wednesday on the playing fields at the grange school in shrewsbury .
craig was an outstanding english teacher much loved by his students and a valued colleague and friend .
he will be greatly missed but his influence will remain . ''

documents.title: football : quigley eager to prove himself in english league
text: scott quigley has thanked the management at tns for giving him his chance , but says he ca n't wait to prove himself in the english league now .
he said after eight years with the welsh champions `` it 's about time i made the step into the english system '' .
quigley came through the tns youth system and is leaving for £ 50,000 plus sell-on fees , which is a record for the club .
since you 're a kid you dream of being at an english club in the football league and i just ca n't wait to get going .
it 's a big opportunity for me

documents.title: more council car parks converted to use new £ 1 coins
text: shropshire council says it has been able to convert more machines in its car parks to take the new £ 1 coins .
it said all the machines in shrewsbury would now accept them , along with machines in ludlow , much wenlock and church stretton car parks .
three car parks in bridgnorth now have the machines too and the authority said other machines would be converted `` shortly '' .
the council says it has been waiting in a queue with other councils to get the machines delivered .
the old £ 1 coins will go out of circulation on 15 october .

documents.title: former shrewsbury footballer reveals baby heartbreak
text: the former shrewsbury town footballer ryan woods has been getting messages of support from the footballing community after revealing he and his partner lost their baby .
woods was sold to brentford for a reported £ 1m two years ago and has been a surprise absentee for the past two games .

documents.title: cqc report : hospitals chief exec says improvements in maternity care will take time
text: improvements to the way mothers and babies are cared for is `` going to take a little while '' the chief executive of the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust has said .

simon wright was responding to a cqc report , published this morning , which said further improvement was needed in maternity services , including their management , and that `` learning from safety incidents was not always being shared with all staff '' .
it also said `` a lack of regular postnatal ward rounds meant that high risk postnatal women were not regularly reviewed '' .

mr wright said the new management team put in place to run women and children 's services have `` not been there long enough really to give the cqc confidence that the learning is embedded in the way that they would want to see '' .
and he said the hospital trust had always said the turnaround would take time .
you can never be complacent with this , but i do think that the staff are working really hard to learn the lessons .
they want to make sure that the environment is really safe for mum and baby . ''

documents.title: football : tns striker quigley moves to league one blackpool
text: tns striker scott quigley has signed for league one blackpool on a two-year deal with the option of a further year .
the 24-year-old joins for a fee of £ 35,000 which could rise to £ 50,000 and said he was glad to have the chance to prove himself in the english league .
quigley scored eight goals last term as they won a sixth consecutive wpl title and also scored goals in their champions league run this season .
well my 8 years at @ twitterid have come to an end .
thanks to all the staff and players for making my time there enjoyable .
all the best
all the best quigs .
great move for you pal .
well deserved # topman
cheers cadds
good luck to you quigs
fantastic move for a very talented striker - good luck scott
good luck mate come on a long way since that cameo loan spell .
great move for you
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: three cars set alight in telford
text: three cars were set on fire in telford this morning .
police say someone poured accelerant over one vehicle in overdale at about 04:25 , then set it alight and ran off .
the fire then spread to other two vehicles .

documents.title: armed officers to patrol v festival
text: armed officers will be on patrol for this weekend 's v festival in staffordshire , staffordshire police say .
tens of thousands of people will head to weston park to watch the likes of pink and jay z perform .
the force says the patrols are only for reassurance as there 's no specific threat but say they 're being `` prudent '' given the uk terrorism threat level is currently at severe .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shropshire paralympian recovering after being put on life support
text: a paralympian is recovering after he was placed on life support following an emergency operation .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: villagers get speed sensors reset
text: people in all stretton have persuaded shropshire council to reset the speed-warning sign in their village , so it flashes for any motorist passing at 32mph or above .
they were unhappy that the sign on the b5477 to church stretton was letting vehicles through at speeds of up to 37mph .
the villagers are hoping it might lead to more signs in the county being reset .

letting motorists through without a warning at up to 37mph not only gives then a false sense of security but also puts pedestrians - including children at the two schools on the route to church stretton - at a greater risk from passing traffic . ''
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: slow progress for safe-standing crowdfunding appeal
text: shrewsbury town 's bid to become the first club in the country to have a safe-standing area is off to a slow start .

a crowdfunding appeal set up by the club 's supporter 's parliament to raise the £ 75,000 needed to install around 500 rail seats has raised £ 14,218 after the first 16 days - roughly 18 % of their target .
the appeal , run by an organisation which specialises in crowdfunding for sports clubs has set itself a deadline of 12 september to raise the cash .

documents.title: football : brazil youth side to play friendly in shrewsbury
text: brazil 's under-17s team will be coming to play a friendly at shrewsbury town next month , against the england under-17s team .
england are using it as preparation for the under-18s world cup in india , which takes place in october .
the match will be played on 1 september , the day after england 's under-20s are play holland at afc telford united 's bucks head ground .

documents.title: hedgehog census under way
text: a hedgehog census has been launched by a south shropshire-based charity .

the british hedgehog preservation society , based near ludlow , is one of the partners working on the project to find out more about how and where the animals are living , to help stop a sharp decline in numbers .
the research is being done in partnership with the university of reading and warwickshire wildlife trust .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cricket : shropshire seal victory against wiltshire
text: shropshire 's cricketers won their final match of the minor counties championship season , with will parton 's unbeaten 73 helping them to a six-wicket victory over wiltshire .
david wainwright took 6-73 to limit the visitors to 208 in their second innings and shropshire comfortably reached their target of 238 at bridgnorth .
shropshire end the season unbeaten , with two wins and four draws .
we ended up cantering to the victory with over half an hour 's cricket left to play which when you 're chasing 240 is no mean feat
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: safety concerns linger over maternity
text: maternity services was also singled out for criticism , with inspectors saying they were n't convinced the service had `` an embedded safety and learning culture '' .
it 's not the first time the department has faced criticsim .
health secretary jeremy hunt ordered an investigation into the shrewsbury and telford hospital nhs trust in april after reports that a number of babies may have died unnecessarily .
a ninth avoidable baby death was uncovered at the trust by the bbc in june .

documents.title: inspectors highlight hospital 's problems
text: a lack of senior doctors and nurses , improved but insufficient end-of-life care and problems with ambulance handovers at shropshire 's two main hospitals have all been highlighted as problems by inspectors .
the care quality commission has published its latest report into the care provided by shrewsbury and telford hospitals nhs trust .

overall , the trust , which is currently in the middle of a protracted reorganisation process , has been told it still requires improvement but inspectors have said that things are better compared with the last time they visited in 2014 .
what they 're saying is what we 've been saying for a long long time really , which is that we ca n't deliver the kind of emergency service that our population deserves without strategic change . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : today 's weather in 55 seconds
text: it 's started dry in parts of the region , but it looks like there may be rain coming - here 's today 's forecast .
you can also keep up-to-date at any time by heading to the bbc weather website and getting the latest forecast for your area .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live for shropshire
text: good morning from bbc local live for shropshire .
this is where you can find the latest news , travel and weather updates for the county .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watchdog critical of baby-deaths trust
text: watchdog critical of baby-deaths trust

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury loan player to tns
text: shrewsbury town have agreed to loan young left back callum roberts to the new saints until january .
he spent time on loan with hednesford town last season and signed his first professional deal with shrewsbury in the summer .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: newly-installed traffic lights to remain on
text: the newly-installed traffic lights at the ketley brook roundabout in telford are going to be left on , telford and wrekin council has decided .
they are designed to change in response to demand and the authority had been experimenting with switching them off , after complaints from motorists .
but it has concluded the increase in journey times was outweighed by the improvement in safety for pedestrians .

the journey time difference between the new lights being on and off is minimal and does not justify the additional costs we would have to spend on making changes to the pedestrian crossing to make it safe , or the increased risk of accidents if the lights were to be switched off . ''

documents.title: weather : another fine day forecast for tomorrow
text: if you enjoyed the sunny weather today then we 're forecast more of the same tomorrow , with temperatures reaching around 21c ( 70f ) again .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: cricket : final match for long-serving shropshire scorer
text: today is not only the final day of the minor counties championship season for shropshire - it 's the final game for their long-serving scorer , colin barthorpe .
he 's been recording every run and dot-ball for 17 years and says the highlights have included the county 's two trips to the minor counties knock-out finals .
and he 's a good game as his swansong - shropshire are 136-2 , chasing down 238 to beat wiltshire .

documents.title: your photos : a sunny august afternoon in stapleton and ludlow
text: it 's been a beautiful afternoon in shropshire and we 're continuing to get photos of the county from the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken near stapleton ( top ) and ludlow ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: advice sessions for small businesses
text: a series of advice sessions for small businesses are going to be put on in shropshire this autumn .
the marches growth hub is planning to visit oswestry , ludlow , bridgnorth and shrewsbury , giving tips on getting support and funding .
the sessions will be three hours long , with the first at oswestry cricket club on 13 september .
there is a wide range of funding and support available for shropshire smes to aid business growth and these free roadshows will offer them tailored and succinct advice right on their doorstep . ''

documents.title: telford woman threatened in her own home
text: a woman in her 20s has been threatened in her telford home by four people who barged their way in this morning .
the police say the two men and two women confronted her on the doorstep of the house on downton court , in hollinswood , at 02:30 , before entering the property .

documents.title: cricket : shropshire chase victory target of 238
text: shropshire have been set 238 to win their final minor counties championship match of the season .
that 's after bowling wiltshire out for 208 in their second innings .
and they 've made a good start , at 72-0 .

documents.title: football : telford manager sticking to his plan
text: afc telford united manager rob edwards says he wo n't be making any drastic changes following last night 's defeat , their third in a row .
he said the players were `` really buying in to what we are trying to do '' and that changing his plans now would risk losing their confidence .
telford travel to play darlington this weekend .
if we keep believing and keep working the right way it will turn .
i 've seen it enough times in football , if you try to rip it up and start again and change , the players do n't believe in what you 're saying
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : riley relieved to be back in full training
text: shrewsbury town 's joe riley says he is relieved to get back to full training .
the full back had an operation after he up an ankle injury in the final game of last season .
he said he 'd had injuries in the past and `` you just have to yourself and get on with it '' and revealed he 'd had a text from the player who caused the injury to wish him well with his recovery .
riley also said he 'd had to cancel a couple of summer holidays because of the injury .

documents.title: concern over plan to move remand cases out of shropshire
text: suspects taken into police custody face having their court cases heard outside the county , under radical plans to shake-up the justice system .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: cricket : wainwright takes six wickets as wiltshire crumble
text: wiltshire are 167-7 at lunch on the final day of their minor counties championship match against shropshire - a lead of just 196 .
david wainwright has now taken six wickets , with the other one going to sam whitney .

documents.title: attempted murderer jailed for robbery
text: attempted murderer jailed for robbery

documents.title: your photos : more sunshine in oswestry and church stretton
text: here are some more of your photos from around the county this afternoon .
they were taken near oswestry and church stretton by bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: plans for railway weighbridge to be explained
text: plans to restore a 150-year-old weighbridge in bishop 's castle will be set out at a meeting this afternoon .
the bishop 's castle railway society wants to save the building , on the site of the town 's former railway station , and estimates the work will cost about £ 50,000 .
the society is considering a lottery bid and will be explaining its ideas at the town hall between 16:00 and 20:00 .

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers prepare for pre-season friendlies
text: telford tigers have lined up pre-season friendlies for their two teams over the bank holiday weekend .
their division one side will be travelling to the north east to play billingham stars on 26 august , while coventry blaze nihl to come to the telford ice rink , to play the tigers division two team .
billingham stars will then come to telford on the sunday , to play the tigers division one team .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: teenager taken to hospital after car oveturns
text: a 17-year-old man was taken to hospital yesterday evening after his car overturned at duddleston .
west midlands ambulance service said it was called to cross lane at 20:22 and that he was treated for back and neck pain .

documents.title: cricket : shropshire take three early wickets
text: shropshire have taken three early wickets on the final morning of their match with wiltshire at bridgnorth .
the visitors are now 94-4 , with all four wickets going to david wainwright .
that 's a lead of 123 .

documents.title: oswestry advertizer front page : war of words over events venue plans
text: a row has broken out over plans to turn hayes barn , in oswestry , into a luxury events venue .
author: Oswestry & Border Counties Advertizer

documents.title: teacher dies after school field collapse
text: teacher dies after school field collapse

documents.title: teacher dies after collapsing on school football field
text: tributes have been paid to a teacher who died after suffering a suspected cardiac arrest on a school football field .
craig colley , a teacher at ellesmere 's lakelands academy , collapsed and stopped breathing at the grange school , shrewsbury , at 19:45 on wednesday .
west midlands ambulance service paramedics were unable to restart his heart at the scene .
a number of local football clubs have paid their respects to mr colley in statements on facebook .
allscott afc said : `` his passion , desire and love for the game , his players and parents was something to behold . ''
shrewsbury juniors football club said : `` craig served loyally and enthusiastically for many years as one of our passionate managers . ''

documents.title: no more space at cat rescue centre
text: the rspca rescue centre , at dorrington , says it ca n't take in any more cats because it is full .
gonsal farm already has 52 cats and kittens waiting for new homes with another being looked after in private boarding .
it says it is especially keen to find homes for older cats such as eight-year-old ashton ( above left ) and 10-year-old podgey ( above right ) .

documents.title: your photos : sunshine in madeley and myddle
text: we 've had a bright morning in shropshire and we 're seeing lots of sunshine in the photos being shared by the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken near madeley ( top ) and myddle ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cricket : final day of minor counties championship season
text: shropshire 's cricketers are bowling again on the final day of the minor counties championship season .
yesterday they were bowled out for 389 .
and when bad light ended play early , wiltshire were 20-1 , a lead of 49 .
play at bridgnorth is due to resume at 10:30 .

documents.title: villagers want help for wild flowers in verges
text: people living in the myndtown area are hoping to persuade shropshire council to change the way it cuts their roadside verges , to encourage wildlife .
the parish council has involved local people in a survey of verges in the area , which also includes norbury , ratlinghope , and wentnor .
it is suggesting mowing them at different times of year and removing cuttings might help wild flowers grow and support other forms of wildlife .
a meeting 's taking place at edgton parish hall tonight to discuss the idea .
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : edwards refuses to criticise players after third successive defeat
text: afc telford united were beaten 1-0 away to curzon ashton last night , but manager rob edwards refused to criticise his players afterwards .
it was the team 's third successive defeat and edwards accepted it was `` really frustrating '' for the team and the fans .
but he said `` the players can take no blame , because their work-rate was frightening '' and he thought his team `` dominated the game '' .

documents.title: telford taxi driver murder probe : police investigations continue
text: investigations are continuing after a taxi driver was killed in a crash in telford .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: one year on since the death of dalian atkinson
text: the family of footballer dalian atkinson says the passing of time will not weaken its resolve to find out the facts surrounding his death - one year ago today after being tasered by police .
the device was deployed against the former aston villa star at his father 's house in telford .
he was 48 .
a year has gone by and we 're still reeling from our loss .
dalian was our baby brother .
our determination to get to the facts and to see that appropriate action is taken will not be weakened by the passing of time .
we 're buckled in for the long haul . ''
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shropshire teacher dies of suspected heart attack at football session
text: a shropshire teacher has died after suffering a suspected heart attack while football coaching .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: it will be a much drier and brighter day on the whole with a low risk of catching a brief shower .
there will be plenty of sunny spells and it will feel warm in the sunshine - highs of 23c ( 73f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: dalian atkinson 's family 'still reeling from loss '
text: the family of dalian atkinson say they 're still reeling from their loss , a year after the death of the former aston villa star .
the 48-year-old died after being tasered by police last august outside his father 's house in telford .
police watchdog investigators are still looking into the case .
in a statement released by the family , they say they 're determined to get to the facts and are in it `` for the long haul '' .

documents.title: follow our coverage throughout the day
text: we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather from across the area until 18:00 .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: football : telford bring in burton striker on loan
text: afc telford united hope their new signing marcus dinanga can help sharpen their attack .
dinanga is a 20-year-old striker with championship side burton albion , and has joined telford on a season-long youth loan .
last year he scored 30 goals in a similar loan to matlock town in the northern premier league .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: open-air screening of top gun for raf museum
text: the raf museum at cosford is going to be putting on a screening of top gun on a giant inflatable screen next month .
it will be 24ft tall and will sit between the vc10 and hercules and one of the aircraft at the museum is going to be opened up as a popcorn stall .
it 's the first time the museum has tried an open-air cinema event , but it is already looking for suggestions for the next one .

documents.title: weather : heavy rain tonight and some showers tomorrow
text: we 're forecast some heavy rain tonight , but it will be a much better day tomorrow , with just a few showers expected .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: cricket : shropshire close in on wiltshire total
text: shropshire are closing in on wiltshire 's first innings total of 418-7 .
at tea on the second day at bridgnorth they were 367-8 , 51 runs behind the visitors .
captain steve leach has been the top-scorer so far with 86 and there have been 50s from ross aucott and jack mciver .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: football : telford midfielder hoping for better fortune against curzon ashton
text: after two tough games against teams expected to challenge for promotion , afc telford united are hoping to get back to winning ways against curzon ashton tonight .
midfielder jack rae said both brackley and salford were `` well organised '' with `` really , really experienced players '' .
rae went on to say he hoped the pressure they 'd been able to exert recently will turn into goals this time .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: police record more than 100 crimes involving drones in three months
text: in the three months from 1 april to 30 june the police recorded more than 100 crimes involving drones over shropshire , herefordshire , worcestershire and warwickshire .
the majority involved drones flying over properties , but there were also two reports of drones being shot at , seven of drones flying over prisons and one of a drone flying over a police station .
warwickshire police recorded 30 incidents in that period and west mercia police 80 .
and there were reports of drones crashing into gardens and sports fields and one of an owner trespassing to recover their drone .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : large copper globe rolled around shrewsbury
text: did you spot a woman rolling a large copper ball around shrewsbury at the weekend ?

she is janetka platun , a local artist , and she has mounted small cameras in its surface so she can record people talking about subjects like like `` home '' , `` belonging '' , `` community '' and their place in the world .
the conversations will be mixed with footage of it rolling through the streets to create a film which will go on show in london and shrewsbury .

documents.title: your photos : cloudy and damp around oswestry and church stretton
text: it 's been another damp august day , with the bbc weather watchers sharing photo of thick cloud and drizzle from around the county .
these were taken in oswestry ( top ) and church stretton ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: campaign launched as figures reveal growing horror of shropshire knife crime
text: today figures released by west mercia police show that the national rise in knife possession and violent attacks is also reflected in shropshire .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: man beaten up outside telford cinema
text: a man in his 30s has needed hospital treatment after being kicked and punched outside the odeon cinema in telford town centre at the weekend .
police say he was standing outside with his partner just before 21:00 on saturday when he was attacked by three men .
he suffered a broken nose and a swollen eye .

documents.title: stokesay court to celebrate 10 years of atonement
text: shropshire 's most famous movie location is celebrating the tenth anniversary of the release of the film atonement , which put it on the global map .
author: Shropshire Live

documents.title: your photos : the wrekin from the sky
text: this photo of the wrekin has been shared with us by jase garton , who said he took it 2,000 feet in the air this morning .

documents.title: cricket : shropshire batting after rain delayed start
text: shropshire are batting after a rain-delayed start at bridgnorth and are 193-4 , replying to wiltshire 's first innings 418-7 .
that means they still trail by 255 runs .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : the rising cost of rural crime
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , we 're reporting on the cost of rural crime as new figures show there 's been a 20 % rise across the west midlands in the first six months of this year .
criminals are targeting tools , 4x4s and livestock and we 'll have a look at what 's being done to try and reverse that trend on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: bollards and rocks annoy residents
text: some of the residents in a shrewsbury sheltered housing scheme say they 're angry that the area in front of their bungalows has been pedestrianised , with plastic bollards and rocks to keep vehicles off .
they say it 's making access to the porchfield estate difficult for people who ca n't walk very far .

the company which looks after the homes , well housing plus group , says it consulted before carrying out the work and that the move was made to protect vulnerable people who want to use the pedestrian areas .

car parking is already provided at porchfields and pedestrianised areas are clearly designated for the safety of residents , some of whom have significant impairment to their mobility , hearing or vision .
the safety of residents has to be our priority ''

documents.title: fire at oakengates flats thought to be deliberate
text: a fire at a block of flats in oakengates at the weekend was probably started deliberately , the police have said .
the fire service was called to buttery grove at 02:55 on saturday and said it caused extensive damage .
residents from four properties had to be evacuated and have been found other places to stay , but none needed medical treatment .

documents.title: former shrewsbury and england cricketer ties the knot
text: former shrewsbury cricket club and england international cricketer james taylor has tied the knot with his girlfriend josie .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: american football : revolution drawn at home to morcambe bay in play-offs
text: shropshire revolution 's reward for their perfect 10-0 season is a home tie against the number eight seed morcambe bay storm in the division two play-offs .

the line-ups have been confirmed with the completion of the regular season and the other matches in the nfc2 quarterfinals will see leeds bobcats host staffordshire surge , glasgow tigers at home to aberdeen roughnecks and gateshead senators playing chester romans at home .
the matches will be played on 20 august , with shropshire playing their match on the pitch at oakengates leisure centre .

documents.title: artist pushes large copper globe through streets of london and shrewsbury
text: a shrewsbury artist , who is pushing a large copper globe around the country , was in her home town at the weekend .
janetka platun says the ball represents the planet and she is using it to collect stories , by asking people what they feel about their place in the world .

she says it is a partnership with the shrewsbury museum and art gallery and will be pushing the 50kg ( 110 lb ) globe around shropshire over the coming days and then plans to take it to india in november .
it has already been taken for a spin around london and her eventual aim is to put it on display at the geffrye museum of the home in london .
this ball has lived a life , it started off free of imperfections , a completely shiny copper ball .
but each time it has gone around the mean streets of east london , it 's slowly degraded and scarred so each journey has been mapped and is leaving its impression . ''
author: Richard Tisdale
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: man quizzed after whitchurch firearms incident
text: a 31-year-old whitchurch man was arrested on saturday afternoon , on sus of unlawful possession of a firearm and threatening behaviour with a firearm .
police were called to an address in queensway in whitchurch at 14:00 and say the incident was resolved peacefully .
the man has since been released on bail until 8 september .

documents.title: delayed roadworks get under way
text: work to repair castlefields way in telford has got under way this morning , after a delay of a week .
tests had revealed cracks on the road surface , as well as subsidence and problems with its sub structure .
the road will be closed from the castlefields roundabout to just past southall road for 18 days .

documents.title: football : shrewsbury continue perfect start to league season
text: shrewsbury town have continued their perfect start to the league season , with a 1-0 win away to wimbledon at the weekend .
alex rodman 's early goal was the difference between the sides .
after the match , manager paul hurst said he thought striker carlton morris was n't as good as he was last week , that he looked tired and that he thought he was having problems with his hamstring .
and hurst also praised his three subs , saying they `` all contributed and did well '' .

documents.title: shropshire 's cricketers set for day two at bridgnorth
text: shropshire had a difficult first day in their final minor counties championship match of the season against wiltshire at bridgnorth .
batting first , wiltshire reached 418 for 7 from 90 overs and at the close shropshire were 77 for 2 , trailing by 341 runs .
play resumes at 11:00 this morning .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cost of rural crime rises sharply
text: the cost of rural crime has increased significantly in the first six months of 2017 .
research by the insurance firm nfu mutural suggests a 20 % increase nationally , with criminals targeting tools , vehicles and even livestock .
this is a crime that can run from hundreds of pounds to hundreds of thousands of pounds but one of the biggest impacts is obviously anxiety and stress . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : telford play curzon ashton
text: afc telford united have an opportunity to bounce back from two successive defeats when they play curzon ashton in greater manchester tonight .
telford lost 2-0 to salford at the bucks head on saturday and 3-1 to brackley at home on the previous tuesday , turning their opening day win at york into a distant memory .
tonight 's opponents have won one of their three games so far and are n't expected to be among the challengers for promotion this season .
telford 's manager rob edwards wants his team to be better on the ball .
we need to be able to keep the ball in their final third more , so we need to be a little bit more ice cold when we 're in possession .
it comes down to fine details . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: steps fall victim to sue council
text: a man who fell down a stairway in bridgnorth last year is suing shropshire council .
stephen harrison , from highley , fell down the steps next to the main bridge near the river severn and suffered bleeding on the brain and post concussion syndrome .
there 's a case here whereby history should n't cause injury or a possible death , and i nearly died .
if they 're of historical interest they could be closed and put in a glass case or they could be repaired . ''

a spokesperson for shropshire council said that the many historical features across shropshire that are maintained by the council are inspected for safety defects on a regular basis and any identified defect is repaired in a timely fashion .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : monday 's full weather forecast
text: here 's how the day 's looking across the west midlands and you can keep yourself up-to-date at any time with the bbc weather website .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live for shropshire
text: good morning .
this is bbc local live for shropshire and we 'll bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather today .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire
